simplesect.para: This page is the Home Page.

simplesect.title: Detailed Description
simplesect.para: Definition at line 25 of file MainPage.xaml.cs
The Documentation for this struct was generated from the following file:

section.title: override async void AppStore.MainPage.OnNavigatedTo (NavigationEventArgs e)
section.emphasis: <summary> The methods provided in this section are simply used to allow NavigationHelper to respond to the page's navigation methods.
section.para: Page specific logic should be placed in event handlers for the NavigationHelper.LoadState and NavigationHelper.SaveState. The navigation parameter is available in the LoadState method in addition to page state preserved during an earlier session.

entry.para: Provides data for navigation methods and event handlers that cannot cancel the navigation request.

section.title: override void AppStore.MainPage.OnNavigatedFrom (NavigationEventArgs e)
section.emphasis: <summary> The methods provided in this section are simply used to allow NavigationHelper to respond to the page's navigation methods.
section.para: Page specific logic should be placed in event handlers for the NavigationHelper.LoadState and NavigationHelper.SaveState. The navigation parameter is available in the SaveState method in addition to page state preserved during an earlier session.

entry.para: Provides data for navigation methods and event handlers that cannot cancel the navigation request.

section.title: void AppStore.MainPage.GridFeaturedApps_SelectionChanged (object sender, SelectionChangedEventArgs e)
section.emphasis: <summary> Executed when the user taps/selects an app from the Featured-Apps section.

entry.para: Object Sender is a parameter called Sender that contains a reference to the control/object that raised the event.

SelectionChangedEventArgs e an instance of SelectionChangedEventArgs including, in many cases, an object which inherits from SelectionChangedEventArgs. Contains additional information about the event, and sometimes provides ability for code handling the event to alter the event somehow.
